text: No problem! Hope it works out for you :slightly_smiling_face:
This is working now!  Thanks so much!

I'm having an issue using `blog_recent_posts`. For some reason it's returning an empty array `[]` although it had previously been working, and I don't understand why it isn't now.

The code is this:
```{% set number_of_posts = 4 %}
{% set blog_id = 4114464473 %}
{% set all_blogs = blog_recent_posts(blog_id, number_of_posts) %}
Blog data: {{ all_blogs }}```
And this just gives back:
```Blog data: []```
The blog id appears to be correct, and I've also tried using `"default"` which returns the same.
What's additionally odd is that the `blog_recent_tag_posts` function does return posts when using the same `blog_id` and specifying a category tag like this:
```{% set all_blogs = blog_recent_tag_posts(blog_id, 'finance', number_of_posts) %}```
I'd like it to just give back all blogs regardless of tagging...

I'm new to HubSpot am I misunderstanding how this works?

Hello. When grabbing file IDs from videos, I'm seeing a lot of inconsistency.

file_by_id(module.video.player_id)

This generally gives an ID that is one digit higher than the actual video file ID. But occasionally, it is further off. Looking at one now where the ID value is 51 higher. What would cause this?
